name: Call Me by Your Name (2017) Quiz | Call Me By Your Name | 10 Questions

questions.text: Elio (Timothée Chalamet) is spending the summer with his family in their house in Northern Italy when Oliver (Armie Hammer) comes to stay. What is the reason for his visit?
questions.correct: He is a graduate student coming to do research with Elio's father.
options: He is a professional cyclist who is staying at the house while he trains.
He is a construction worker who is renovating the house.
He is a backpacker who is travelling through the region.
questions.explanation:
He is a graduate student coming to do research with Elio's father.

	Elio's father (Michael Stuhlbarg) is a professor of archaeology who has a graduate student come to his house for the duration of each summer to help him with his research. Near the beginning of the film, Mr. Perlman tests Oliver's knowledge by deliberately making an etymological mistake - Oliver passes the test with flying colours. At the time that the film is set, Elio is 17 and Oliver is 24.

questions.text: Elio doesn't particularly like Oliver when he arrives at the house. Which of the following is one of the main reasons for this?
questions.correct: Elio has to give up his bedroom to Oliver.
options: Elio's parents ask him to make Oliver breakfast.
Oliver likes to play loud techno music in the garden.
Oliver borrows Elio's bike and punctures a tyre.
questions.explanation:
Elio has to give up his bedroom to Oliver.

	Elio is most certainly not smitten when Oliver first arrives at the house. Elio is very cerebral and quiet, preferring to spend most of his time reading books. Whilst Oliver is learned, he is also loud and gregarious, something that initially grates on Elio.

questions.text: Elio is already in a relationship with another man when Oliver arrives in town.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Elio is not in a relationship with another man, but he does have girlfriend called Marzia. Elio maintains this situation whilst his relationship with Oliver is developing, and at one point tells his family and Oliver that he has slept with Marzia, in part to see how Oliver reacts. Later in the film, Elio decides that he cannot maintain both relationships and begins to avoid Marzia.

questions.text: One of the first times that Oliver interests Elio is when he massages Elio's shoulders. What game is everyone playing at the time?
questions.explanation:
Volleyball.

	Elio and his friends are hanging out and some of them, including Oliver, are playing volleyball. During a break in the game, Oliver comes over to get some water, and massages Elio's shoulders. Both characters are topless, and it is the first physical contact between the two of them.

questions.text: In one of the most memorable scenes of the film, Elio watches Oliver dancing enthusiastically at a local disco before he joins him on the dance floor. What song is playing during this scene?
questions.correct: 'Love My Way' by The Psychedelic Furs
options: 'I Love Rock 'n Roll' by Joan Jett and the Blackhearts
questions.explanation:
'Love My Way' by The Psychedelic Furs.

	The scene starts with a shot of Oliver's shoes as he dances to the music, before cutting to a wider shot that shows him completely losing himself on the dance floor. Elio is initially smoking a cigarette and watching the disco, but decides to get up himself after watching Oliver.  The three incorrect answers were the top three songs from Billboard Hot 100 end of year chart in 1982 (the year 'Love My Way' was released). Olivia Newton-John was first, Survivor second and Joan Jett third.

questions.text: Without saying in explicitly, Elio finally tells Oliver that he has feelings for him. Where are they when he breaks the news?
questions.correct: At a World War I memorial
options: In the dining room of the house
By the side of a lake
In a museum of local history
questions.explanation:
At a World War I memorial.

	The two of them cycle into town and arrive at a memorial for the Battle of Piave, a topic that Elio knows a lot more about than Oliver. Oliver asks him "is there anything you don't know?", to which Elio replies "I know nothing Oliver...about the things that matter".  Understanding his meaning, Oliver asks "Why are you telling me this?", and Elio ultimately replies "because I wanted you to know". Despite the fact that their relationship is growing, Oliver tries to discourage Elio from letting it go any further.

questions.text: As their relationship develops, Elio and Oliver become increasingly intimate. After they sleep together for the first time, Oliver says to Elio "Call me by your name, and..." what?
questions.explanation:
"I'll call you by mine."

	"Call me by your name, and I'll call you by mine" can be interpreted in many ways, one of which is that it asserts the complete confidence and safety that they characters can have with one another. After they have slept together, Elio and Oliver spend more and more time together. Later in the film they go on a three-day trip to the city of Bergamo, encouraged by Elio's parents.

questions.text: At the end of the film, Elio and Oliver establish a stable long-term relationship.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Unfortunately for both Elio and Oliver, Oliver has to return to the United States to complete his studies. Their trip to Bergamo is something of a last hurrah, with Oliver taking the train directly to the airport to fly home. The final scene of the film is set in winter, and Oliver phones Elio to tell him that he is engaged. In a heartbreaking finish, Elio sits by the fire and cries while the credits roll.

questions.text: Which Italian director, also known for 'Melissa P.', 'I Am Love' and 'A Bigger Splash', directed 'Call Me By Your Name'?
questions.explanation:
Luca Guadagnino.

	Luca Guadagnino frequently collaborates with the actress Tilda Swinton, and she plays a lead role in both 'I Am Love' and 'A Bigger Splash'. In addition to directing 'Call Me by Your Name', Guadagnino also produced the project. All three of the incorrect answers are contemporary Italian directors. Paolo Sorrentino is known for 'The Great Beauty' and 'Youth', Matteo Garrone for 'Gomorrah' and 'Tale of Tales', and Alice Rohrwacher for 'Corpo Celeste' and 'The Wonders'.

questions.text: 'Call Me by Your Name' won just one Oscar at the 2018 ceremony, the award for Best Adapted Screenplay. Which veteran writer, also known for directing literary adaptations such as 'Howard's End' and 'The Remains of the Day', wrote the screenplay?
questions.explanation:
James Ivory.

	'Call Me by Your Name' is adapted from a novel of the same name by the American author  André Aciman. As the book details the story of both the original romance and a second meeting 20 years later, there has been some suggestion of a sequel to 'Call Me by Your Name'.  At the age of 89, James Ivory became the oldest person ever to win both and Oscar and a BAFTA in any category with his wins in 2018. Aaron Sorkin and James Mangold were also nominated for Best Adapted Screenplay in 2018, for their work on 'Molly's Game' and 'Logan' respectively. Jordan Peele won the Oscar for Best Original Screenplay for penning the script for 'Get Out'.
